175.article_body: The rhinoceros who was injured after being hit by a truck in Assam's Haldibari recently is found to be doing good, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Tuesday. He also shared a drone video taken this morning. "Urge all to be kind to our animals. Go slow while passing through corridors, where you know some animals might cross," he added.

176.title: Power Grid acquires SPV to establish inter-state transmission system
176.article_body: Power Grid Corporation of India said it has acquired 100% equity in ER NER Transmission (ETL) under tariff-based competitive bidding. According to the company's filing, ETL will serve as a special-purpose vehicle to build an interstate transmission project. The project consists of upgradation works at 400/132kV Banka (Bihar) and building 220kV D/C transmission lines in Assam and Arunachal Pradesh.

177.title: Liquor smuggling accused's illegal properties demolished in Haryana
177.article_body: The Haryana Police on Tuesday demolished two illegal buildings built on government land in Sonipat district. The structures belonged to a man allegedly involved in over 18 cases of liquor smuggling, police said. Joint teams comprising the district police and the municipal committee demolished the structures with the help of bulldozers and JCB machines.

178.title: AIIMS Delhi considering system to refer patients to other hospitals
178.article_body: Director of All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi, Dr M Srinivas is set to discuss with representatives of 20 hospitals near the AIIMS premises a mechanism to refer stable patients from its emergency ward. The referral system is expected to reduce the number of patients waiting outside the AIIMS Emergency section due to a shortage of admission beds.

179.title: Boney breaks down remembering Sridevi at event marking 10 yrs of 'English...'
179.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor broke down while talking about his late actress-wife Sridevi at an event celebrating 10 years of her film 'English Vinglish'. A video showing Boney being consoled by filmmaker R Balki has also surfaced online. Sridevi passed away in 2018 while she was in Dubai to attend a family wedding.

180.title: Bommai panic-stricken over response to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in K'taka: Cong
180.article_body: The Congress on Tuesday criticised the BJP and said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai is panic-stricken over the response that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is getting in his state. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala accused Bommai of running a "corrupt" and "incompetent" government. "Your incompetence is becoming legendary and your mal-administration is exemplary. Stop fooling people," Surjewala tweeted.

181.title: DU extends registration deadline for admissions till October 12
181.article_body: The Delhi University (DU) has announced that the registration deadline for admissions to the university has been extended by two days, till October 12. According to an official statement, the decision was taken in the "interest of the candidates who are still in the process of deciding their preferences". Candidates can apply at the DU website: admission.uod.ac.in.

182.title: Intel confirms its proprietary source code has been exposed: Report
182.article_body: Intel has reportedly confirmed that its 'Alder Lake BIOS' source code has been leaked by a third-party in a 6GB file containing tools and code for building and optimising 'BIOS/UEFI' images. The BIOS/UEFI code works to initialise a computer's hardware before the operating system has loaded.  "We don't believe this exposes any new security vulnerabilities," an Intel spokesperson said.

183.title: Germany will make it through winter if we continue to adapt: Scholz
183.article_body: Germany will make it through the winter if its citizens, companies and policymakers continue to adapt to the country's changed energy situation, Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday. Germany has almost achieved its target of having its gas storage facilities 95% full, he added. Europe is facing an unprecedented energy crisis due to tensions with Russia over the Ukraine war.

184.title: Javed Akhtar says Dharmendra refused to do Big B's 'Zanjeer', actor reacts
184.article_body: Dharmendra reacted after lyricist Javed Akhtar stated that the veteran actor had rejected Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Zanjeer'. Dharmendra tweeted, "Reality often remains unheard in this world full of show-offs." "Refusing 'Zanjeer' was an emotional hurdle which I have mentioned in 'Aap ki Adalat'. So please don't misunderstand me," Dharmendra wrote in another tweet.

185.title: Safex Chemicals acquires UK's Briar Chemicals in £73 million deal
185.article_body: Agro-chemical firm Safex Chemicals India said that it has acquired Briar Chemicals for £73 million from German investment firm AURELIUS Equity Opportunities. Neeraj Jindal, Director of Safex, has joined the Board of Briar Chemicals and will oversee its future growth. Piyush Jindal, Director of Safex, said the company has entered the UK market through this acquisition.

186.title: Ghaziabad civic body identifies 14 waterlogging spots in city
186.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation said that they conducted inspections and identified 14 waterlogging spots in the city which require immediate intervention. "There were more than 100 such low-lying areas and these have now been reduced to only 14. We have directed teams to deploy pumps and draw out stagnant water," said Nitin Gaur, GMC Commissioner.

187.title: Man fires at booth staff after being asked for toll in MP; video surfaces
187.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man firing at toll booth attendants after they allegedly refused his request to be treated as a VIP and asked him to pay toll charges in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. The man took two cars, one carrying a family, through the Baretha toll booth. An employee near the man narrowly escaped from being shot.

188.title: Infosys President Ravi Kumar S resigns
188.article_body: Infosys on Tuesday announced the resignation of the company's President Ravi Kumar S, effective October 11, 2022. "The Board of Directors placed on record their deep sense of appreciation for the services rendered by Ravi Kumar S for his contributions to the company," Infosys said in a regulatory filing. Ravi led Infosys Global Services Organization across all industry segments.

189.title: Nobody should have to go to jail for smoking weed: US Vice President Kamala Harris
189.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris backed Joe Biden administration's decision to pardon thousands of Americans convicted of simple marijuana possession, saying "nobody should have to go to jail for smoking weed". Harris said the pardons were the first step in taking further action on decriminalising marijuana across the nation. "We're urging governors and states to take our lead," she stated.

190.title: BJP workers wave slippers, call TMC MLA Manik 'chor' near WB court
190.article_body: BJP workers waved slippers and chanted "chor, chor" (thief, thief) as TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya was brought to West Bengal's Bankshall Court on Tuesday. A video showed the workers chanting, "Chor aaya chor aaya" (The thief is here). The former President of the West Bengal Board of Primary Education has been arrested in connection with the teacher recruitment scam case.

191.title: 22-yr-old dies after wall of toilet collapses in UP's Budaun
191.article_body: A 22-year-old youth, Virendra, died after the wall of a toilet in his house collapsed following heavy rains in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun, police said. The deceased, a resident of Nagla Taru village, died in the incident that occurred on Monday evening, police added. The family members of the youth rushed him to a hospital where he was declared dead.

192.title: Family of Thane man killed in accident gets ₹30 lakh compensation
192.article_body: Motor Accident Claims Tribunal has awarded ₹30.19 lakh as compensation to the parents of a 24-year-old man who died in a road accident in Thane. The man had died after a generator van rammed into the two-wheeler on which he was travelling with his girlfriend. The van's owner and its insurance company have been directed to jointly pay the compensation.

193.title: 15 students, driver hurt as school buses collide in TN's Cuddalore
193.article_body: At least 15 students and a driver were injured after two school buses collided near Virudhachalam in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore on Tuesday. As per reports, the accident took place when one of the buses was racing with the other vehicle belonging to the same institution. The injured students were rushed to a hospital in Virudhachalam for treatment.

194.title: India equal world record for most wins in a year, clinch ODI series against South Africa
194.article_body: India defeated South Africa by seven wickets in the third ODI to clinch the series 2-1. India equalled the world record for most victories in international cricket in a calendar year by winning 38 matches in 2022. Australia had set the record with 38 victories in 2003. The match witnessed South Africa record their lowest-ever ODI total (99) against India.

195.title: Reserve 10-15% hospital beds for patients of vector-borne diseases: Delhi govt
195.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said all hospitals in Delhi have been asked to reserve 10-15% beds for patients of vector-borne diseases. "The government has put all hospitals across Delhi on alert and is keeping an eye on the situation. Hospitals have been directed to...ensure that no patient is denied admission due to lack of beds," Sisodia added.

196.title: Very sad to lose a friend whom I had known since 1974: Swamy on Mulayam
196.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy expressed his condolences on the demise of former UP CM and the founder of Samajwadi Party, Mulayam Singh Yadav. "Very sad to lose a friend (Mulayam) whom I had known since 1974. A man of large heart and [trust] which many took advantage of, but he never complained and remained cheerful," Swamy said.

197.title: Make sex reassignment surgeries free at hospitals: DCW to Delhi govt
197.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to the Delhi government, seeking an order to all government hospitals with necessary facilities, to provide free sex reassignment surgeries (SRS) to transgender people. The notice said that the Delhi government is providing the treatment free of cost at one hospital, it can do the same at all government hospitals.

198.title: PM couldn't attend Mulayam's funeral, asked me to pay tributes: Rajnath
198.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh, who attended Mulayam Singh Yadav's funeral in UP's Saifai on Tuesday, said PM Narendra Modi asked him to pay tributes to the late SP founder as he couldn't attend the funeral. "We had a very strong relationship...Mulayam Singh Yadav was a big personality in Indian politics," Rajnath said. Several other leaders were present there.

199.title: Eknath Shinde faction of Shiv Sena gets '2 swords & shield’ as election symbol
199.article_body: The Election Commission has allotted the 'two swords and shield' symbol to the Shiv Sena faction led by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde for the Andheri East bypoll. They will be called the 'Balasahebanchi ShivSena'. The EC allotted the name 'Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray)' and the 'flaming torch' symbol to former CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction on Monday.

200.title: Russia adds Meta to its list of 'terrorist and extremist' organisations
200.article_body: Russia's financial monitoring agency, Rosfinmonitoring, has added Facebook and Instagram parent Meta to its list of "terrorist and extremist" organisations, AFP and Russia's Interfax news agency reported. In June, a Russian court rejected an appeal by Meta after it was found guilty of "extremist activity" in the country in March. At the time, Meta's lawyer had denied the allegation.

201.title: Having Big B, Sridevi in 'English...' was like Oh My God moment: Director
201.article_body: 'English Vinglish' director Gauri Shinde revealed that having Amitabh Bachchan and Sridevi in the same film was like an "Oh My God moment" for her. "Who wouldn't jump on an idea like this? Amit Ji was gracious to do this for my film and all the credit goes to R Balki," she added. Amitabh had a cameo in the film.

202.title: 3, including 7-yr-old, killed in road accident in Madhya Pradesh
202.article_body: A couple and their seven-year-old son were killed when an unidentified vehicle hit their motorcycle on a national highway in the Rajgarh district of Madhya Pradesh. The deceased, Kalyan Singh Bairwa (37), Guddi Bai (35) and their son Ankush (7), were returning to their village, police said. All three of them died on the spot.

203.title: BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal likely to become IPL Chairman: Report
203.article_body: BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal is reportedly to take up the position of the IPL Chairman. According to a report, BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla was interested in succeeding current Chairman Brijesh Patel as he's set to vacate the position when he turns 70 next month. However, Dhumal will likely take up the position while Shukla will continue as BCCI VP.

204.title: Those expecting a lopsided victory are in for a surprise: Tharoor
204.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that those who are expecting a lopsided victory for the "establishment" are in for a surprise when the votes are counted. He said that Congress leaders who haven't supported him because of the fear of upsetting senior leaders have expressed support privately and may eventually vote for him in a secret ballot.

205.title: Who is 'General Armageddon', Russia's new commander of Ukraine war?
205.article_body: Russia's Vladimir Putin has appointed Sergei Surovikin nicknamed 'General Armageddon', known for being 'ruthless', as commander of the Ukraine war. While leading a military expedition in Syria, he reportedly ordered the bombardment that destroyed much of Aleppo. He reportedly ordered a shootout of pro-democracy protesters in Russia and a Colonel under him killed himself after he reprimanded him.

206.title: I'm not comfortable doing TV shows as I'm very lazy: Tripling's Sumeet
206.article_body: 'Tripling' actor Sumeet Vyas said he is not comfortable working in TV shows as he's not very hardworking. "I'm very lazy, they're very hardworking people," he added. Sumeet stated he enjoys working on a web series as long as the character is interesting. "It doesn't matter if it's a film or a show...you're looking for a creative experience," he added.

207.title: Pune reports highest number of swine flu deaths in Maha this year
207.article_body: About 46 people died due to swine flu in Pune since January 1 this year, a state health department official said. This is the highest number of deaths reported in Maharashtra followed by Kolhapur which has reported 19 deaths so far in 2022. Notably, Maharashtra has reported nearly 3,000 cases of swine flu and 147 deaths so far in 2022.

208.title: Mulayam Singh chose 'larger good' over claim of being PM: Yechury
208.article_body: CPI (M) leader Sitaram Yechury recalled a moment he shared with late Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, saying that the former UP CM chose the "larger good" over a "legitimate claim" of being PM. Yechury talked about an interesting period when the then Congress President Sitaram Kesri withdrew support to the HD Devegowda government in 1997.

209.title: State govt's efforts to stop stubble burning working: Haryana CM
209.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday said the state government's efforts to stop stubble burning are yielding results and just 81 cases have been recorded this season. "Action has been taken against the defaulters," Khattar said. The government has permitted the use and sale of only green crackers to curb pollution ahead of the festive season, he added.

210.title: Kuldeep has got this amazing feature to bowl repetitive lengths: Ashwin
210.article_body: Praising India spinner Kuldeep Yadav, teammate Ravichandran Ashwin said, "He has got this amazing feature to bowl the repetitive lengths that are required to do well in...long format." Ashwin added, "He can land in a particular spot whenever he wants...that's a fantastic quality for a wrist spinner." Kuldeep took four wickets in the third ODI against South Africa.

211.title: 16,000 special buses to be operated for Deepavali to help travellers in TN
211.article_body: Tamil Nadu Transport Minister Sivasankar SS on Monday said the state will be operating 16,888 special buses from October 21 to 23, to cater to travellers in view of the Deepavali festival on October 24. A total of 6,300 regular buses alongside 4,218 special buses would be operated from Chennai to other parts of the state, a release stated.

212.title: Health dept to launch 'KCR nutrition kits' in 9 districts: T'gana minister
212.article_body: Telangana Health Minister T Harish Rao on Monday said the state health department will soon launch 'KCR nutrition kits' in nine districts. The kits are designed to provide a proper diet to pregnant women, especially those suffering from anaemia, Rao said. These kits are expected to help approximately 1.5 lakh women and will be provided during checkups in government hospitals.

213.title: Nissan to sell its Russia business for 1 euro
213.article_body: Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan will hand over its business in Russia to a state-owned entity for one euro, the company said on Tuesday. Nissan will be taking a loss of around $687 million as it will exit from Russia. The move makes Nissan the latest major company to leave Russia since it sent its troops into Ukraine in February.

214.title: Mulayam Singh touched lives of many in India and beyond: Nepal PM
214.article_body: Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on Tuesday tweeted, "I express my deepest condolences on the passing away of Shri Mulayam Singh Yadav Ji, former CM of Uttar Pradesh and a veteran politician of India." "As an eminent socialist leader, late Yadav touched lives of many in India and beyond," he added. The 82-year-old Samajwadi Party founder passed away on Monday.

215.title: International League T20 trophy unveiled in Dubai, Aryan Khan shares pics
215.article_body: The trophy for the inaugural season of UAE's International League T20 was unveiled in Dubai on Monday. Sharing pictures from the trophy reveal event, Abu Dhabi Knight Riders co-owner Aryan Khan wrote, "What an awesome looking trophy! Had a great evening at the ILT20 trophy reveal event. Wishing @ilt20official and @adkriders a fantastic inaugural season."

216.title: Boman Irani, Satish Shah to join Hirani's 'Dunki' starring SRK: Reports
216.article_body: Boman Irani and Satish Shah will reportedly be sharing screen space with Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki', an upcoming film being directed by Rajkumar Hirani. Satish will be seen as a London-based lawyer who fights the cases of illegal Asian immigrants while Boman will play the role of a teacher who gives English-speaking classes to Punjabi youth, as per reports.

217.title: Hyderabad's Gandipet Park opens for public, Minister KTR tweets pics
217.article_body: The Gandipet Park in Hyderabad has been opened to the public as Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated it on Tuesday. The park has an amphitheatre with 1200 seating capacity, an entrance plaza adorned with 12 welcome arches, a flower terrace, picnic zones, walkways, art pavilions, a toilet block and food courts.

218.title: GST e-invoicing must for firms with over ₹5 cr turnover from Jan: Report
218.article_body: GST e-invoicing has reportedly been made mandatory for all businesses with annual turnover of over ₹5 crore from January 1, 2023. The target is to bring all businesses with turnover of over ₹1 crore under this framework by next fiscal year, Economic Times quoted a government official as saying. E-invoicing entails validation of transaction details in a centralised government portal.

219.title: Shah Rukh Khan met 20 fans in Chennai after wrapping Atlee's 'Jawan'
219.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan recently met 20 of his fans in Chennai after wrapping up a schedule of Atlee's 'Jawan'. Sudhir Kothari of the actor's Chennai fan club shared that Shah Rukh booked two rooms at a five-star hotel and took care of their requirements. A collage of SRK's pictures with his fans is being shared widely on social media platforms.

220.title: Indira Gandhi was worried by JP Narayan's agitation: Amit Shah
220.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised the Congress and former PM Indira Gandhi and claimed that she was worried by the agitation led by Jayaprakash Narayan during the Emergency. "The biggest contribution of Jayaprakash Narayan was when he started a massive agitation against corruption and against a government drunk on power that imposed the Emergency in the 70s," said Shah.

221.title: BBMP to construct flyover between Hebbal & Chalukya Circle to relieve congestion
221.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is planning to build a flyover on Bellary Road between Chalukya Circle and Hebbal. The flyover would decongest the stretch connecting the central business area with northern Bengaluru and Kempegowda International Airport, known for traffic snarls for years. "A private agency will be roped in to prepare a comprehensive report," a BBMP official said.

222.title: 3 beat man with sticks after being stopped from blowing horn in Guj
222.article_body: A 19-year-old was allegedly beaten by three people with sticks in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after he raised an objection to unnecessary honking. The incident took place on Sunday when one of the accused was honking continuously near the victim's cafe. The accused, who visited the cafe regularly, returned with two friends and attacked the victim, identified as Mihir Kansara.

223.title: New York City Mayor recreates Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' step, video surfaces
223.article_body: A video showing New York City Mayor Eric Adams doing Allu Arjun's hand brush signature move from the film 'Pushpa' has surfaced online. The video showed Eric doing the step with actress Anasuya Bharadwaj. Eric attended an event organised by Telugu community in the city where he interacted with the people and also celebrated the festival of Bathukamma with them.

224.title: Guj couple mistook for kidnappers as mute 5-yr-old throws tantrums
224.article_body: A couple in Gujarat's Vadodara was cornered by locals for being kidnappers of their five-year-old child, who was throwing tantrums. When the couple explained to the police that their child was hearing impaired and thus, also mute, the police sought identity proof to resolve the matter. A team of police officials visited their house, said ACP, C Division, Megha Tewar.

225.title: India delivers 13th batch of medical assistance to Afghanistan
225.article_body: India on Tuesday delivered the 13th batch of medical assistance consisting of essential medicines and medical/surgical items to Afghanistan. As per the Ministry of External Affairs, the items were handed over to authorities of the Indira Gandhi Children Hospital in Kabul. Till date, India has supplied almost 45 tonne of medical assistance including 500,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccine to Afghanistan.

226.title: 2 Pakistani fishermen arrested by BSF off Gujarat coast
226.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) has arrested two Pakistani fishermen near the India-Pakistan border off the Kutch district coast in Gujarat. Both the fishermen have been identified as Yasin Sheikh (35) and Mohammad Sheikh (25). According to reports, the Naliya Air Force Station in Kutch noticed the movement of six fishing boats at 11:40 am on Monday.

227.title: UAE President to meet Putin to discuss Ukraine war
227.article_body: The UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan will head to Russia on Tuesday to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin and discuss the latest developments in Ukraine war, UAE's foreign ministry said. The ministry also said that the UAE seeks to achieve positive results for military de-escalation and reach a political settlement to achieve global peace and security.

228.title: Gandhis have made it clear they are neutral: Tharoor ahead of Cong chief poll
228.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said the Gandhis have made it clear that they are staying above the fray and are neutral. He said, "Many electors have been instructed by their leaders to support my rival but may eventually vote for me in a secret ballot." The party's Presidential poll will be held on October 17.

229.title: Mahatma Gandhi museum opens up in Atlantic City
229.article_body: A museum dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi has opened in Atlantic City of the United States of America. It has artefacts and digital display screens that are interactive and visitors will be able to see the life events of him. It is developed in partnership with the Aditya Birla Group by the New Jersey-based Gandhian Society.

230.title: Farmers in Punjab's Kapurthala who burned stubble to lose welfare benefits
230.article_body: Deputy Commissioner of Punjab's Kapurthala, Vishesh Sarangal, on Tuesday said farmers engaged in stubble burning would be put out of the bracket of any government welfare scheme. Such farmers would also not be eligible for passport verification and arms licences, Sarangal said. Punjab government has provided 4,100 machines to manage stubble and distributed 651 machines in current season, he added.

231.title: Can't call it bigger than someone's financial problem: Tahira on her cancer
231.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said that she did have breast cancer but she cannot say her problem is bigger than someone who's having a financial problem or a relationship problem. "Problems aren't bigger or smaller, it all depends upon one's life state. If a person's life state is strong, they can brave any situation," she added.

232.title: 50 overs are just a little bit too long now: Aus' Khawaja on ODIs future
232.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja has said that 50 overs are "a little bit too long now" and the ODIs should be reduced to 40-over a side. "I played Pro40 in England a few years ago when they were playing 40-over cricket. I really enjoyed it," added Khawaja. "T20 cricket is awesome. Test cricket is the pinnacle," he further said.

233.title: Google paid off competitors from making alternate app stores: Epic Games
233.article_body: Epic Games, developer of Fortnite, has accused Google of antitrust practices claiming that the latter paid off competitors and prevented them from developing alternate app stores. "Google spent a billion dollars on secret deals with the top app developers," Epic Games said in a court filing. Google is currently under investigation for its store fees.

234.title: A lot of things being done by Guj for 1st time in country: PM Modi
234.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said when the speed of development is as swift as that in Gujarat, list of works and achievements is so long that it's difficult to count. He launched multiple development works in Ahmedabad today. "As always, there are a lot of things that Gujarat is doing for the first time in the country," he added.

235.title: Belarus says joint troop deployment with Russia is defensive measure
235.article_body: Belarus on Tuesday said the joint deployment of its troops with Russian forces near the Ukrainian border is meant as a defensive measure. "All the activities...are aimed at responding adequately to actions near our borders," the defence ministry stated. Belarus on Monday said the move was in response to what it called a threat from Kyiv and its Western allies.

236.title: FSSAI registration must for foreign food manufacturers selling milk, meat
236.article_body: Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has made it compulsory for foreign food manufacturing facilities to register with it for exporting certain products to India from February 1. Facilities exporting food under five categories: milk and milk products, meat and meat products, including poultry, fish and their products, egg powder, infant food and nutraceuticals must be registered.

237.title: Investors lose ₹6 lakh cr as Sensex falls 1,075 points in 3 sessions
237.article_body: Investors lost ₹6 lakh crore as Sensex fell 1,075 points in three sessions and market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms came down to ₹269.8 lakh crore, provisional exchange data showed. Shares of Reliance Industries Limited, Infosys, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank and Tata Consultancy Services fell the most for both Sensex and Nifty. Stocks of 2,344 firms on Sensex fell on Tuesday.

238.title: Roger Federer's farewell event at Swiss Indoors Basel postponed
238.article_body: Roger Federer's farewell ceremony at Swiss Indoors Basel was postponed after the Swiss said he has been trying to process everything that's happened lately. Federer played his last match in his farewell tournament at Laver Cup last month. "Celebration at home in Basel will have a very special meaning and is now too short for me after London," he added.

239.title: India proposes new group for growth of startups across G-20 nations
239.article_body: India has called for a new engagement group for the growth of startups across G-20 nations and urged the countries to adopt open source and inter-operable platforms such as UPI and Aadhaar to promote inclusive digitisation across the world. DPIIT Secretary Anurag Jain said that knowledge, innovation and sustainability have emerged as the new age drivers of economic growth.

240.title: Automotive Axles gains after Cummins' open offer to buy 26% stake
240.article_body: After Cummins Inc made an open offer to buy up to 26% stake in Automotive Axles, the latter's shares climbed over 5% on Tuesday. The open offer is for the acquisition of 39.29 lakh fully paid-up equity shares at the value of ₹1,504.3 apiece. At 1:25 pm, Automotive Axles' stock was trading 3.7% higher at ₹2,072 apiece on the BSE.

241.title: I've been given instructions to be ready for finishing role: Samson
241.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson has revealed that he has been asked to be ready to play a finisher's role in white-ball cricket. "I've been given instructions to be ready and do this finishing role since the last year," he stated. Samson has scored 86* and 30* in his two innings in the ongoing ODI series against South Africa so far.

242.title: Jaya, Abhishek Bachchan attend Mulayam Singh's funeral in Saifai
242.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, along with his mother and Samajwadi Party leader Jaya Bachchan, reached UP's Saifai to attend the funeral of Samajwadi Party founder and former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav. People chanted "netaji amar rahein" as a vehicle carried the mortal remains of Mulayam Singh Yadav for his last rites in Saifai.

243.title: Y Combinator-backed Explorex raises $5 million in seed funding
243.article_body: Explorex, backed by Y Combinator, has raised $5 million in its seed funding round led by prominent angel investor Taher Savliwala. Founded in 2020 by Mainak Sarkar and Pritam Khan, Explorex has built an operating system designed to assist restaurant operations and management. Prominent angel investors from Silicon Valley invested in Explorex's pre-seed funding round.

244.title: JSW Cement to invest ₹3,200 crore to set up 2 plants in MP and UP
244.article_body: JSW Cement said it will invest over ₹3,200 crore to set up two greenfield cement manufacturing facilities with a manufacturing capacity of 5 MTPA. A manufacturing facility will be set up in Madhya Pradesh and a split grinding unit in Uttar Pradesh. On Monday, India Cements announced selling its entire stake in Springway Mining to JSW Cement for ₹476.87 crore.

245.title: Ukrainians sing patriotic songs as they shelter from Russian airstrikes
245.article_body: Residents of Kyiv were filmed singing Ukraine's national anthem and patriotic songs in a metro station as they sheltered from Russian airstrikes on Monday. Ukraine's Defence Ministry also shared a video of people singing in the metro station, saying, "Ukraine's spirit is unbreakable." Another video showed children in Kyiv singing the national anthem as they huddled in a bomb shelter.

246.title: 2 Australian regulators launch investigation into Optus data leak
246.article_body: Two Australian regulators have launched an investigation into Optus after data of upto 10 million customers was compromised. The Office of the Australian Information Commissioner said it was looking into whether Optus took reasonable steps to protect customer data. The Australian Communications and Media Authority said it was probing whether Optus met industry obligations in keeping personal data.

247.title: Taiwan, Japan chip stocks fall, $240 bn wiped out from global market value
247.article_body: After the US imposed export curbs on China's access to semiconductor technology, chip-related stocks in Japan, South Korea and Taiwan declined. This led to the wipeout of over $240 billion from the sector's global market value. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company's shares fell more than 8% on Tuesday, while stocks of Samsung Electronics Company and Tokyo Electron Limited also declined.

248.title: 17-year-old boy shot dead after demanding payment for gutkha in Chhattisgarh
248.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was shot dead in Chhattisgarh’s Bilaspur allegedly by two men who refused to pay after taking gutkha from him, a police official said on Monday. "One of the accused shot him in his abdomen…then fled from the area. The teenage boy was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead," Prakash Kant, Masturi Station House Officer, said.

249.title: Hyd Police seizes ₹3.5 cr cash being sent to poll-bound T'gana seat
249.article_body: Unaccounted cash worth ₹3.5 crore that was reportedly being sent to Telangana's Munugode assembly seat was seized by the Hyderabad Police on Monday. Six people have been detained in this connection. A police officer said that the cash was meant for distribution ahead of the by-poll slated for November 3.

250.title: Pic shows Shikhar Dhawan's look from his Bollywood debut film 'Double XL'
250.article_body: Huma Qureshi and Sonakshi Sinha's 'Double XL' will mark cricketer Shikhar Dhawan's Bollywood debut. A still from the film, which explores the journey of two plus-size women, shows Shikhar in a black suit, dancing with Huma. Talking about his role, Shikhar said, "When this opportunity came to me and I heard the story, it made a deep impact on me."

251.title: Ukraine reduces electricity exports to Moldova after Russian strikes damage grid
251.article_body: Moldovan Deputy PM Andrei Spinu said that Ukraine has reduced electricity supplies to Moldova by about 30%. On Monday, Ukraine had announced that it was suspending electricity exports to the European Union after Russian missile strikes damaged significant parts of the country's energy grid. "We're in constant contact with Ukraine...European Union and Romania in search of a solution," Spinu added.

252.title: 2 killed, 10 injured as minibus collides with car in Manipur
252.article_body: Two men were killed and 10 others injured after a passenger minibus crashed into a car on National Highway 2 in the Karong area of Manipur's Senapati district on Tuesday. The minibus fell into the Barak river after the collision. The injured victims were taken to a hospital. Two of them were said to be in critical condition.

253.title: Goons thrash student for not touching their feet in Ghaziabad; video surfaces
253.article_body: A video showing two men in Ghaziabad thrashing a student allegedly for not saying 'namaste' and touching their feet every day while going to school has surfaced online. They can be seen intimidating the kid, pulling him by his hair and beating him up mercilessly in the video. The state police have asked Ghaziabad Police to look into the matter.

254.title: China steps up testing in major cities, curbs movement as COVID cases rise
254.article_body: Chinese cities including Shanghai and Shenzhen have ramped up testing as number of COVID-19 infections rise. Authorities reported more than 2,000 new local infections on October 10, the highest since August 20. Shanghai authorities will be conducting mass testing at least twice a week in all 16 districts until November 10. Schools, entertainment venues and tourist spots have been closed.

255.title: We got what we wanted from practice sessions in Aus: Team India coaches
255.article_body: In a video released by BCCI on Twitter, India batting coach Vikram Rathour said they arrived early in Australia because they wanted to get used to the conditions ahead of the T20 WC. "The bounce out here...is totally different," added bowling coach Paras Mhambrey. "We [are] pretty happy...I think we got what we wanted," stated fielding coach T Dilip.

256.title: Unicorn startups in India have almost doubled since 2021: PM Modi
256.article_body: India is one of the world's top startup hubs with number of unicorn startups having almost doubled since 2021, PM Narendra Modi said while addressing the Second United Nations World Geospatial Information Congress. "In India's development journey, two pillars are key- technology and talent," he added. As of September 7, 2022, India has 107 unicorns with a $340.79 billion valuation.

257.title: Great sign: PM as daily domestic air passenger traffic nears pre-COVID level
257.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday termed the number of daily domestic air passengers hitting the four-lakh mark and nearing the pre-COVID-19 level as a "great sign". Appreciating the country's civil aviation sector, PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "Our focus is to further improve connectivity across India, which is important for 'Ease of Living' and economic progress."

258.title: South Africa record their lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket
258.article_body: South Africa were dismissed for 99 runs in 27.1 overs against India in the third ODI in Delhi on Tuesday. It's South Africa's lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket. As many as eight South Africa batters failed to score in double digits. South Africa's previous lowest ODI total against India was 117, registered on September 26, 1999 in Nairobi.

259.title: YouTuber 'Dream', who recently revealed his face, quit his job at Apple to create content
259.article_body: Popular YouTuber 'Dream', who recently revealed his face and identity as 23-year-old Clay from the US, quit his job at Apple and had $20,000 saved when he decided to become a full-time content creator. In 2020, he became YouTube's top "breakout" star. 'Dream', known for streaming Minecraft game, recently met his fans in person for the first time at TwitchCon.

260.title: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' crosses ₹400-cr mark worldwide
260.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' has crossed the ₹400-crore mark worldwide. As per trade sources, it will do another ₹120 crore to take the lifetime gross of the film to over ₹500 crore. The film, starring Vikram, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Trisha, was released in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam.

261.title: Rahul shares pic of girl crying on meeting him, says, 'I'll tell you why'
261.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has shared a picture of a girl and his brother who came to him during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. Sharing the picture on Facebook, Gandhi wrote, "This girl broke into tears during our conversation...I'll tell you why." "She and her brother...are deeply distressed at witnessing the India of their dreams being crushed before their...eyes," he added.

262.title: Sardar Patel was okay with J&K joining Pak: Cong counters PM's claim
262.article_body: Countering PM Narendra Modi's recent claim on the Kashmir issue, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said that Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel "was okay with J&K joining Pakistan till September 13, 1947". PM Modi had said that "one person", an apparent reference to Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, couldn't resolve the Kashmir issue while Sardar Patel merged all other princely states.

263.title: 43-yr-old forest dept employee in Thane held for taking ₹50,000 bribe
263.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has arrested a 43-year-old accountant with the forest department in Thane for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹50,000, the ACB said on Tuesday. The accused allegedly demanded ₹70,000 from a man to provide a no-objection certificate for purchase of a land, but the deal was settled at ₹50,000, the ACB said in a release.

264.title: Heroin worth ₹47.4 cr packed in soap cases seized in Assam; 1 held
264.article_body: The BSF and Assam Police have seized over 9 kg of heroin worth about ₹47.4 crore which was packed in soap cases after they intercepted a truck in Karimganj. State CM Himanta Biswa Sarma called it the "biggest haul" and tweeted that the heroin was hidden in the truck's "secret chamber". The driver of the truck has been arrested.

265.title: Russian attack on Ukrainian cities is war crime: Bucharest Nine group of countries
265.article_body: Bucharest Nine group of countries and Presidents of North Macedonia and Montenegro have said recent mass bombardments of Ukrainian cities by Russia are war crimes under international law. Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Estonia, Lithuania, Latvia, Slovakia, Romania and Poland constitute Bucharest Nine. Ukraine's capital Kyiv and other cities like Lviv, Dnipro and Kharkiv were hit by missiles.

266.title: My trip to space felt like a funeral: William Shatner, oldest man to fly to space
266.article_body: 'Star Trek' actor William Shatner, 91, who became the oldest person to travel in space when he flew out in a Blue Origin spacecraft, penned his experience in a book. He wrote, "My trip to space was supposed to be a celebration; instead, it felt like a funeral...The contrast between the...coldness of space and...warm nurturing of Earth...filled me with...sadness."

267.title: He still walks like a tiger: Rakesh Roshan on Big B's 80th b'day
267.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, speaking on Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, said, "He still walks like a tiger." He added that the veteran actor is "very punctual" and "very dedicated to his work". "He attends all ceremonies. He replies to every message. So I'm trying to follow in his footsteps...and maybe, when I'm 80, I'll walk like a tiger too," said Rakesh.

268.title: 'Amar Akbar...' screening halted at midnight to wish Big B on b'day in Mumbai
268.article_body: The screening of 'Amar Akbar Anthony' was halted at midnight at a theatre in Mumbai to wish actor Amitabh Bachchan on his birthday. A video of the incident was shared by Free Press Journal. In the video, the audience can be seen standing and clapping while a picture of the actor can be seen displayed on the big screen.

269.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar switched sides five times for power: Amit Shah
269.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and said that he has switched sides five times for power. "This is not the path shown by JP Narayan. He never did anything for power and worked for principles all his life...Leaders who achieved heights through the JP movement are sitting in Congress' lap," said Shah.

270.title: No water supply for Pune's Hadapsar, Manjari & other areas on Thursday
270.article_body: The water supply in many parts of Pune will be disconnected on Thursday, October 13, due to electrical and civil works in the water supply centres. These areas include several locations in Hadapsar, Manjari, Vadgaon Sheri and Sinhagad. The city's water supply department has urged the public to prepare accordingly and assured that emergency tankers would be available on request.

271.title: BMC undertakes concretisation, resurfacing & repair work of roads
271.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken concretisation, resurfacing and repair work of roads across Mumbai. To avoid digging up on concretised roads later, the BMC will simultaneously replace old pipelines wherever required. "The pipelines in suburbs are old and need replacement in some places," a civic official said. The estimated cost of the project is ₹12 crore.

272.title: PM Modi lays foundation stone of healthcare facilities worth ₹1,275 cr in Gujarat
272.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday laid the foundation stone of healthcare facilities worth around ₹1,275 crore in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. PM Modi said that besides the new building for Gujarat Cancer and Research Institute, facilities like upgraded bone marrow transplant are beginning. "It will be the country's first government hospital that will offer modern facilities like CyberKnife," he added.

273.title: Vehicle carries Mulayam Singh's remains, people chant 'netaji amar rahein'
273.article_body: People chanted "netaji amar rahein" as a vehicle carried the mortal remains of former Uttar Pradesh CM and SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav for his last rites in UP's Saifai. A convoy of 300 vehicles carried his body to Saifai from Gurugram's Medanta Hospital, where he passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

274.title: Congress has outsourced contract of abusing me: PM Narendra Modi
274.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that Congress has "outsourced" the contract of abusing him. He claimed that the "silent strategy" of the Opposition party is being "controlled by those who...conspire against Gujarat from Delhi". A day earlier, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had asked if PM Modi is campaigning for Congress in Gujarat after he warned BJP workers about Congress.

275.title: Over 300 BEST bus conductors to protest in Mumbai over new salary rule
275.article_body: Over 300 bus conductors with the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply Transport (BEST) undertaking will stage a protest at Wadala depot in Mumbai today against the transport authority’s latest rule on ticket dispensing machines, the workers' union said. As per the new rule, the salaries of conductors will be cut if the ticket dispensing machine gets damaged.

276.title: Sensex falls over 800 points, Nifty ends below 17,000 points
276.article_body: The benchmark indices ended in the red for the third consecutive session with the Sensex falling 843.79 points to 57,147.32 on Tuesday. The Nifty fell 257.50 points to end below the 17,000 level. Divi's Labs, IndusInd Bank, Nestle India, JSW Steel and Eicher Motors were among the top Nifty losers. Stocks of Axis Bank, Adani Enterprises and Asian Paints gained.

277.title: Palghar Police solve 15 theft cases; 2 persons arrested
277.article_body: Palghar's Kelva Police claimed to have solved 15 cases of house-breaking thefts in the Maharashtrian district with the arrest of two persons. Gold ornaments worth ₹15.08 lakh from the two accused, police said. There had been a theft in a house on September 30 allegedly committed by the accused and 14 other cases were solved with their arrest, police added.

278.title: Truck overturns on eatery in West Bengal's Alipurduar, 2 killed
278.article_body: At least two persons, aged 48 and 55, were killed after a truck overturned on an eatery at Choupathi in West Bengal's Alipurduar on Tuesday, police said. The 12-wheeler truck was transporting urea from Assam to Siliguri and overturned on Asian Highway-48 at Choupathi, police added. The driver lost control of the vehicle, police further said.

279.title: Delhi Metro in financial crisis, seeks ₹3,500 cr each from Centre & Delhi govt
279.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) told High Court that the company is reeling under financial crisis. It also sought ₹3,500 crore each from central and Delhi governments to pay a 2017 arbitral award to a Reliance subsidiary. DMRC added that it owes around ₹7,010.08 crore to Delhi Airport Metro Express Pvt. Ltd, out of which ₹2,599 crore has been paid.

280.title: Nani celebrates audiences' response to Rajamouli's 'Eega' at Beyond Fest
280.article_body: Telugu actor Nani celebrated audiences' response to SS Rajamouli's 'Eega', which was recently screened at the Beyond Fest 2022, Los Angeles. On Monday, Nani shared that people's response to the 2012 release has taken him back to "first day first show memories" of the film. "A decade later, other side of the globe. Same love same energy," the actor added.

281.title: Don't see BJP or Cong, see who is thinking about you: Nadda in Himachal
281.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday, while addressing an event in Himachal Pradesh’s Bilaspur, said, "Don't see BJP or Congress, see who is thinking about you and BJP is only doing that." He added, "I'll tell Congress supporters that we have got an opportunity now, so support us, we'll work for everyone."

282.title: Video shows people waving swords at Eid-e-Milad celebrations in B'luru
282.article_body: Police arrested 19 youths, including minors, on Tuesday for allegedly brandishing swords and other weapons while celebrating Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi on the streets in Bengaluru. This comes after a video showing people dancing and jumping while waving weapons emerged on social media. The accused have been booked under the Arms Act. The incident took place in the Siddapura Police Station limits.

283.title: Over 200 families in Assam's Dhemaji hit by floods after heavy rains
283.article_body: Parts of Assam, including Guwahati, were waterlogged after heavy rains in the past few days. Over 200 families in villages of the Dhemaji district were affected by floods. Several hectares of cropland and roads were submerged in water. Several villagers were forced to leave their homes and take shelter in safer places.

284.title: Yellow alert issued for parts of Karnataka for next 2 days: IMD
284.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for several districts in Karnataka for two days. It has predicted that the state will receive between 64.5 mm and 115.5 mm of rainfall. "A cyclonic circulation lies over north Tamil Nadu's neighbourhood and extends up to 1.5 km above mean sea level,” the Met department said.

285.title: Robbers steal gold, silver & cash worth ₹28 lakh from Mumbai store
285.article_body: A gang of burglars stole gold, silver and cash worth ₹28.30 lakh from a jewellery shop in Mumbai's Borivali and escaped in a car, despite being caught red-handed by the jeweller. The owner, upon entering his store, found the iron shutter open and the glass door shattered, police said. He spotted two robbers and raised an alarm.

286.title: California Governor's wife to testify at Harvey Weinstein's sexual assault trial
286.article_body: Jennifer Siebel Newsom, actor and wife of California Governor Gavin Newsom, is among the accusers of movie producer Harvey Weinstein who'll testify at his rape and sexual assault trial, currently underway in Los Angeles, her attorney said. "My client was sexually assaulted by...Weinstein at a purported business meeting that turned out to be a trap," Newsom's attorney Elizabeth Fegan added.

287.title: SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav cremated with full state honours
287.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder and three-time UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav was cremated with full state honours at his native village Saifai in Uttar Pradesh. Yadav's son and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav lit his pyre. Many politicians including Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav attended the funeral.

288.title: 2 women beheaded & buried in 'human sacrifice' by couple seeking prosperity in Kerala
288.article_body: Two women were allegedly kidnapped, beheaded and buried as part of a suspected "ritualistic human sacrifice" in Kerala's Pathanamthitta, police said. The women were allegedly 'sacrificed' by a local healer and his wife who sought to appease God to be financially prosperous, police said. The women's bodies were chopped into pieces and buried on farmland next to the couple's house.

289.title: 500 pilot whales die on remote New Zealand islands
289.article_body: About 500 pilot whales have died in mass strandings on New Zealand's remote Chatham Islands, the government said. On Friday, 250 beached pilot whales were found at Chatham Island, and three days later another 240 were reported on Pitt Island. "Due to the risk of shark attack...the surviving whales were euthanised...to prevent further suffering," a government technical marine advisor said.

290.title: Lee Jung-jae to charge ₹5.7 cr per episode for 'Squid Game 2': Report
290.article_body: South Korean actor Lee Jung-jae will charge ₩1 billion (approximately ₹5.7 crore) per episode in the upcoming 'Squid Game 2', many South Korean media outlets reported. The first season of 'Squid Game' was nominated in 14 categories at the 74th Emmy Awards. Lee became the first Asian to win the Emmy award for lead actor in a drama series.

291.title: Historic day: Scindia ahead of Mahakal Temple Corridor inauguration
291.article_body: Ahead of the inauguration of the first phase of ₹850-crore Mahakaleshwar Temple Corridor Development Project by PM Narendra Modi in Ujjain on Tuesday, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that it's a historic day. "PM Modi has resolved to establish India not just as an economic power but also as a spiritual power in the world," Scindia added.

292.title: UP man's house attacked over communal social media post; 25 arrested
292.article_body: A total of 25 people were arrested after a mob attacked a man's house in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda after he allegedly posted communally sensitive remarks on social media, police said. The violence erupted on Monday night but it's under control now, police added. A case has been registered against the man and he too has been arrested, police further said.

293.title: History-sheeter accused of several murders, rape held by Navi Mumbai Police
293.article_body: A history-sheeter with at least seven major crimes against his name, including murders, rape and extortion, has been arrested by Navi Mumbai Police. The accused used to run an extortion racket with his gang members and had killed people for ransom, police said. The Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) was also invoked against the accused earlier.

294.title: I'd love to be part of any WC team, be it T20 WC or ODI WC: Shubman Gill
294.article_body: India batter Shubman Gill, in a recent interview, revealed that he likes opening with Shikhar Dhawan. The 23-year-old, who's currently playing in the three-match ODI series against South Africa, also expressed his desire to play in a World Cup, stating, "I'd love to be a part of any WC team, be it for the T20 WC or the ODI WC."

295.title: Odisha CM to hold meetings with business tycoons in Hyd on Oct 17
295.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik is set to hold the Odisha Investors' Meet in Hyderabad on October 17. "To woo investors and present investment opportunities in Odisha, CM...will hold one-on-one meetings with business tycoons," the Chief Minister's Office said. The meet will focus on discussions with investors in IT sector. A roadshow for investors will also be organised in the city.

296.title: Transgender attacked, forced to drink phenyl by 3 people in Mumbai
296.article_body: A 28-year-old transgender was allegedly attacked with a sharp weapon and was forced to drink phenyl by three people in Mumbai on Sunday, ANI reported. The accused reportedly attacked the transgender for refusing to withdraw a rape complaint. Meanwhile, police have registered an attempt-to-murder offence and arrested one of the attackers, while the other two are at large.

297.title: Mumbai woman meets fraudster via divorcee matrimonial portal, loses ₹9 lakh
297.article_body: After a divorce from her husband, a woman from Mumbai met a man on a matrimonial portal for divorcees. The man then cheated her of ₹9 lakh, reports said. The man said that he was Vice-President Finance with JP Morgan and then asked the woman to lend her money for his heart surgery.

298.title: I watched the game, I shed a tear: Radwanska on Federer's retirement
298.article_body: Reflecting on Roger Federer's retirement, Wimbledon 2012 finalist Agnieszka Radwanska said,  "Federer is one of a kind. I watched the game and...post-game interview several times. I shed a tear. Icon and legend." She added, "May we soon have a similar talent in...world of tennis, although it'll be extremely difficult to achieve." Federer played his last match at Laver Cup 2022.

299.title: Congress blames BJP, TRS as fire erupts at its office in Telangana
299.article_body: A fire broke out at the Congress party's office in Telangana's Chandur on Monday, days ahead of the bypoll in Munugode. The party alleged that the workers of TRS and BJP were responsible for the incident. Calling it a cowardly act, Congress state chief A Revanth Reddy said BJP and TRS are scared of his party's might.

300.title: Israel, Lebanon reach 'historic' deal on maritime border
300.article_body: Israel and Lebanon have reached a "historic" maritime agreement on the demarcation of a disputed maritime border between them, Israeli PM Yair Lapid said on Tuesday. The deal is expected to allow the beginning of natural gas exploration in the disputed area. "This...will strengthen Israel's security, inject billions into...economy, and ensure the stability of our northern border," Lapid stated.

301.title: Govt to push Apple, Samsung & others for 5G software upgrades: Report
301.article_body: The government will push Apple, Samsung and other mobile phone manufacturers to prioritise launching software upgrades to support 5G in the country, Reuters reported on Tuesday. This comes amid concerns that many smartphone models aren't ready for the recently launched high-speed internet service. PM Narendra Modi launched 5G services on October 1.

302.title: Was shocking: Mila on Will getting ovation at Oscars after slapping Chris
302.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis said it was shocking for her after many people gave Will Smith a standing ovation when he won the Best Actor award at the Oscars after slapping Chris Rock at the event. "I thought, 'Wow, what a time we're living in that rather than do what's right, people focus on doing what looks good'," she added.

303.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 50 CNG buses from Rajghat depot
303.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday flagged off 50 new CNG buses and 66 new vehicles for road safety and bus lane enforcement from Rajghat depot. A total of 7,320 buses are on the roads in Delhi, he tweeted. "By 2025, more than 10,000 buses will be in service of the people of Delhi with 80% electric buses," Kejriwal added.

304.title: 33 cheat cooperative bank of ₹6.3 cr with fabricated documents in Thane
304.article_body: A total of 33 people have been booked for cheating a cooperative bank of over ₹6.3 crore by submitting fabricated documents for procuring loans in Maharashtra's Thane, police said. The accused include 26 home buyers, four builders, a real estate consultant, a housing loan consultant and a valuer of flats. The real estate consultant had allegedly facilitated loans' fake documents.

305.title: I'm one year clean from addiction: The Kapil Sharma Show's Sidharth
305.article_body: Actor-comedian Sidharth Sagar, who is seen on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', shared that he is "one year clean from addiction". "Today, I've no medications, I've a healthy body and mind," he said, adding that he used to have 18 medicines as he was diagnosed with bipolar disorder. Sagar shared he was "addicted, depressed" and "would have hallucinations, schizophrenia and psychosis".

306.title: A true genius, a prodigy: Suresh Raina on Hardik Pandya's birthday
306.article_body: Suresh Raina took to Twitter to wish Hardik Pandya on his 29th birthday and wrote, "Happy birthday to one of the finest players...A true genius and...prodigy to...many who aspire to become like you." "Wishing you abundant love and roaring success," added Raina in his tweet. Kieron Pollard recently described Hardik as a cricketer who comes once in many years.

307.title: BMC initiates action against shops for not using Marathi signboards
307.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) from Monday started initiating action against shops and commercial establishments in Mumbai that failed to put up Marathi signboards after the fourth deadline, which expired on September 30. The present provision states a fine of ₹2,000 per staffer will be imposed on shops. Inspectors appointed by BMC will inspect 3,000 shops daily.

308.title: Haryana bans manufacturing, sale & use of firecrackers ahead of Diwali
308.article_body: The Haryana government has prohibited the manufacturing, sale and use of firecrackers, except green crackers, ahead of Diwali. "Amongst various events, bursting of firecrackers is also an important event affecting air quality levels," an official order read. It added that firecrackers not only release metal particles and dangerous toxins into the air, but also increase harmful particulate matter.

309.title: Startup invents calculator that supports WiFi, shows transactions on mobile app
309.article_body: Indian startup Tohands has developed a "smart" calculator that supports WiFi connectivity and shows transactions on a mobile app. The calculator has a 16MB built-in memory, which can store 50 lakh transactions. It comes with a 2,400-mAh rechargeable battery and a USB-C port for charging. Founded in 2018, Tohands has raised ₹50 lakh in funding to date.

310.title: Lodge waterlogging complaint on MCD 311 app: Delhi civic body
310.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has requested the citizens to download the MCD 311 app to report any issue related to waterlogging in their locality. The national capital has been receiving heavy rainfall for the past few days, causing waterlogging in several areas. On the app, citizens can also complain about issues such as potholes, unattended garbage etc.

311.title: Microfinance sector records 89% YoY growth; disburses ₹49,788 cr in loans
311.article_body: India's microfinance sector grew 88.90% YoY in Q1 FY23, disbursing loans worth ₹49,788 crore against loans worth ₹26,357 crore disbursed in Q1 FY22. Disbursed microfinance loans, however, recorded a 39.20% QoQ decline from ₹81,898 crore worth of loans disbursed in Q4 FY22. A total of 1.24 crore loans were disbursed in Q1 FY23, 67.90% higher than Q1 FY22.

312.title: 525 unclaimed vehicles in accumulation of Cyberabad Police
312.article_body: The Cyberabad Police have an accumulation of 525 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types and makes, which are pooled at Moinabad PS Ground under Cyberabad Commissionerate in Hyderabad. Any person having any objection or ownership interest in any of these vehicles may file an application to claim the vehicle within a period of six months, the police said.

313.title: 16-yr-old gets injured in blast while bursting crackers in Delhi
313.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was taken to a hospital after he got injured while bursting firecrackers in Delhi. According to Delhi Police, he was filling an unascertained substance in a hollow pipe for bursting firecrackers when the incident occurred. Police also reported that such firecrackers are used to frighten animals in the area. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

314.title: 5 French citizens currently held in Iran amid anti-hijab protests
314.article_body: French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna said five French nationals are currently detained in Iran amid anti-hijab protests. Last week, France urged its citizens to leave Iran "as soon as possible", citing the risk of arbitrary detention and unfair trial. Protests are taking place in Iran over 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini's death after being detained by morality police over improper hijab.

315.title: Maha government agrees to transfer Palghar mob lynching case to CBI
315.article_body: The Maharashtra government has agreed to transfer investigation of the 2020 Palghar mob lynching case to the CBI. Earlier, the government had informed the SC that all guilty police officials involved in the case had been punished. On April 16, 2020, a mob lynched two sadhus and their driver while they were travelling to Surat from Mumbai.

316.title: PM Modi wishes Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday, actor responds
316.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday wished actor Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday. "He's one of India's most remarkable film personalities who has enthralled and entertained audiences across generations. May he lead a long and healthy life," PM Modi tweeted. "I thank you for your...wishes. Your words of blessing will always be a source of inspiration for me," Bachchan responded.

317.title: Woman receives cow dung after ordering ₹1,300 watch from Flipkart in UP
317.article_body: A woman from Uttar Pradesh has claimed that she received cow dung in her Flipkart package after placing an order for a ₹1,304 watch. The order was placed during the e-commerce website's Big Billion Days Sale in September. The delivery executive returned the money and collected the delivered item after the woman's brother chased him to settle the grievance.

318.title: Man says he's an astronaut, scams Japan woman into paying for 'return ticket to Earth'
318.article_body: A man pretended to be a Russian astronaut to scam a 65-year-old Japanese woman of ₹25 lakh (4.4 million yen) in the name of a 'return ticket to Earth'. The man, who found the woman on Instagram, told the woman they'd start a life together in Japan on his return. The woman grew suspicious when the man became more demanding.

319.title: I was very, very hard on myself in my 20s: 'Mirzapur' actress Shriya
319.article_body: Actress Shriya Pilgaonkar, who portrayed the character of Sweety Gupta in 'Mirzapur', said she was "very, very hard" on herself in her 20s. Shriya added she started accepting herself wholly during her late 20s. "Every person has their own journey with...when they're going to find love...Social media...has sold this notion to us of how love has to be," stated Shriya.

320.title: Cylinder bursts in kitchen of restaurant in Pune; no casualties
320.article_body: A fire that broke out after a cylinder burst in a restaurant's kitchen in Pune's Hadapsar was contained within a few minutes on Tuesday, a fire officer said. The officer added that a major blaze was averted as a team managed to remove six other cylinders from the kitchen while another team doused the fire. No casualties were reported.

321.title: We have ability to detect & intercept N Korea's missiles: S Korea
321.article_body: South Korean military has said that the country's missile defence system is capable of detecting and intercepting the weapons systems that North Korea said it mobilised in its drills. On Monday, North Korea said that its drills involved nuclear-capable ballistic missiles, warplanes meant to warn Seoul and Washington. South Korea described North Korea's nuclear threats as "very grave and serious".

322.title: All of Ukraine put on alert after Russian missile strikes
322.article_body: Emergency services put all of Ukraine on alert for more missile strikes on Tuesday, a day after Russian missile strikes killed 19 people and wounded over 100 others. "Warning. During the day there's high probability of missile strikes on the territory of Ukraine. Please remain in shelters for your own safety, do not ignore air raid signals," the alert read.

323.title: Some Meta staff refer to metaverse projects as 'make Mark happy': Report
323.article_body: Some employees working at Meta jokingly refer to key metaverse projects as MMH, for "make Mark happy" as its CEO Mark Zuckerberg shifts his priorities, according to a report. The report stated that a shift in priorities has caused a frequent shuffling of employees at the company. Some Meta employees have also complained about frequent strategy shifts, the report added.

324.title: It's a chance I thought would never come round again: Alex Hales on T20 WC
324.article_body: England opener Alex Hales revealed that he didn't see himself playing in the upcoming T20 World Cup a few months ago. "It's a chance I thought would never come round again," added Hales, who replaced injured Jonny Bairstow in England's World Cup squad. The 33-year-old is currently playing in T20Is against Australia and scored 84(51) in the first match.

325.title: Truck carrying scrap metal catches fire on Bengaluru's NICE road; traffic hit
325.article_body: A truck carrying iron and scrap metal caught fire on Bengaluru's NICE road, which affected traffic movement in the area. The truck was reportedly transporting metal materials from Kerala to Maharashtra. The incident occurred after one of the back tyres caught fire, which soon spread to other tyres and the rear half of the truck, a report said.

326.title: I've always been concerned about space for independent music: Kamal
326.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan said he has "always" been concerned about the fact that no space has been provided to facilitate independent music. "We are now only scoring music that is demanded by producers...for stories that they are looking to make into films for almost 100 years," added Kamal. "Even a great musician like Ilaiyaraaja has been forcibly constrained," he stated.

327.title: N Korea has nothing to gain from nuclear weapons: S Korean President
327.article_body: After North Korea launched a series of ballistic missiles, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said the country has nothing to gain from nuclear weapons. "North Korea is...developing...its nuclear weapons and posing nuclear threats to not only our Republic of Korea but the world," he added. Yoon said he would build robust capabilities to counter North's threats through US alliance.

328.title: It never fails to impress, thank you Rajamouli sir: Sudeepa on Makkhi
328.article_body: Discussing his film 'Makkhi', which was directed by filmmaker SS Rajamouli, actor Kichcha Sudeepa tweeted, "Very few films, no matter how many times you watch, no matter how old...never fail to impress all over again." "Thank you Rajamouli sir," added Sudeepa in his tweet. "Rajamouli sir narrated Makkhi's plot in less than 10 seconds," Sudeepa had earlier stated.

329.title: Teams are going to reconsider batting approach: Bangar on Bumrah's absence
329.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that a lot of teams are going to reconsider their batting approach against India in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah. "So, a huge blow for India, but again, one man's loss is another man's opportunity. Hopefully, Deepak, Shami or Arshdeep can be there and leave a mark on the World Cup," added Bangar.

330.title: To be like Amitabh Bachchan, you need more than just talent: Jaya Prada
330.article_body: Jaya Prada on Amitabh Bachchan's birthday called him "a blessing for the film industry". She said one needs to have "much more than just talent" to be like him. "You need to be dedicated, disciplined and focused like him," the actress said, adding that she's proud and grateful that she got the opportunity to work with him in several films.

331.title: CM Gehlot-led govt is only for 350 more days in Raj: Vasundhara Raje
331.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Monday said there are "only 350 days left" for CM Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in the state. While addressing an event in Churu, Raje said, if one excludes time of Model Code of Conduct, CM Gehlot-led government has less than a year to function before it is voted out of power in Assembly polls.

332.title: Will respond to West's growing involvement in Ukraine conflict: Russia
332.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said Russia will respond to the West's growing involvement in the Ukraine conflict although direct conflict with NATO is not in the country's interests. This comes after the US pledged military aid to Ukraine. "We warn and hope that they realise the danger of uncontrolled escalation in Washington and other Western capitals," Ryabkov added.

333.title: Probably not, I'm out of the race: Mitchell Marsh on Aus' ODI captaincy
333.article_body: Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has ruled himself out of the race for Australia's ODI captaincy, stating, "It's not on my radar at the moment." He added, "Cricket Australia has a decision...it's really not something I've thought about." Australia's white-ball captain Aaron Finch retired from ODIs last month and is likely to announce retirement from T20Is after this year's World Cup.

334.title: E-rickshaw topples due to pothole in UP while officials' convoy passes by; video surfaces
334.article_body: An e-rickshaw toppled and fell on a puddle-filled street in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district while a convoy of UP officials was passing by. The video of the incident went viral on social media. The accident comes days after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath directed officials to run a massive campaign for "pothole-free roads" in the state by November 15.

335.title: Man lays electric wire to kill wife, mother-in-law dies instead in MP's Betul: Police
335.article_body: A man laid an electric wire on an iron door to allegedly kill his wife but his mother-in-law came in contact and died instead in Madhya Pradesh's Betul, police said. The wife had gone to her mother's home following a fight, police added. He went to his in-laws' house where he connected the door with a wire, police stated.

336.title: Video shows 3 Chennai students performing stunts with swords on train, arrested
336.article_body: Three students of Presidency College in Chennai have been arrested after they were seen performing stunts with sword-like weapons on a train. Chennai's Divisional Railway Manager took to Twitter to share a video of them performing stunts and confirmed the news of their arrest. "We would like to inform you that we have zero tolerance towards such instances," DRM wrote.

337.title: ICC names 5 emerging players tipped to break out at T20 World Cup 2022
337.article_body: The ICC, on its official website, has named five emerging players tipped to break out at T20 World Cup 2022. The five players are UAE's 20-year-old wicketkeeper-batter Vriitya Aravind, UAE's 21-year-old leg-spinner Karthik Palaniapan Meiyappan, Scotland's 22-year-old all-rounder Brandon McMullen, Netherlands' 22-year-old all-rounder Bas de Leede and Namibia's 19-year-old all-rounder Divan la Cock.

338.title: India to bowl first in ODI series decider, SA make 3 changes to their playing XI
338.article_body: Team India captain Shikhar Dhawan won the toss and elected to bowl first in the ODI series decider against South Africa in Delhi. India have not made any changes to their playing XI, while South Africa have made three changes, with Lungi Ngidi, Andile Phehlukwayo and Marco Jansen replacing Keshav Maharaj, Wayne Parnell and Kagiso Rabada.

339.title: Rajasthan policeman, 2 others gangrape 32-year-old woman in Delhi hotel; arrested
339.article_body: A 34-year-old Rajasthan Police constable and his two friends were arrested for allegedly gangraping a 32-year-old woman in a hotel in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar. According to victim, one of the accused, who knew her, invited her to the hotel, where she was offered a cold drink. She alleged she fell unconscious after consuming the drink and was then sexually assaulted.

340.title: SC issues notice to ED on Satyendar Jain's plea against new judge
340.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) over a plea by Delhi minister Satyendar Jain against transferring the money laundering case to a new judge. Delhi High Court had earlier rejected Jain's plea challenging the transfer of the case against him to a new judge. ED arrested Jain in May in the money laundering case.

341.title: Vlogger keeps pillow and sleeps in middle of Dubai road; police shares pic after arrest
341.article_body: The Dubai Police has shared a picture after arresting the vlogger who kept a pillow and slept in the middle of a busy road. "The Asian man endangered his life and the lives of others," the police wrote. The police also urged community members to use the "Police Eye" platform to report such illegal and harmful practices.

342.title: Technology not an agent of exclusion, but inclusion in India: PM
342.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that in India, technology is not an agent of exclusion, but rather an agent of inclusion. PM Modi made the remark while addressing a UN congress via video message. "We have been working on a vision of Antyodaya, which means empowering the last person at the last mile, in a mission mode," he added.

343.title: Panacea Biotec hits upper circuit after ₹1,040-cr vaccine order
343.article_body: A day after Panacea Biotec Limited bagged orders worth ₹1,040 crore from UNICEF and Pan American Health Organization, its shares surged by 20% to hit the upper circuit of ₹160.8 apiece during Tuesday's opening session. The pharmaceutical company will supply its WHO pre-qualified paediatric vaccine, Easyfive-TT. At 11:18 am, its stock was trading 18.25% higher at ₹158.45 apiece on BSE.

344.title: Never imagined I'd work with Sushmita so soon: Ankur Bhatia on 'Taali'
344.article_body: Actor Ankur Bhatia, who featured with Sushmita Sen in the OTT series 'Aarya', said he didn't expect to get "an opportunity to work with her again so soon" in 'Taali'. Bhatia said his character in the film is "very different" and in a space that he hasn't tried before. The actor also described Sushmita as a "supportive and helpful" co-star.

345.title: 2nd Australian Singtel company hit by cyberattack after Optus
345.article_body: Weeks after Optus faced a data breach that compromised the data of up to 10 million customers, Singapore Telecommunications (Singtel) said its unit Dialog has faced a cyberattack in Australia. The attack potentially affected 1,000 current and former employees. The firm said that Dialog's systems are completely independent of Optus. The latest cyberattack was detected on September 10.

346.title: Suzlon Energy stock falls as firm opens ₹1,200-crore rights issue
346.article_body: Suzlon Energy opened its ₹1,200-crore rights issue on Tuesday and its shares were trading lower in the morning trade. The wind power major is offering 240 crore shares for ₹5 per equity share and the rights issue will close on October 20. At 11:55 am, its stock was trading 3.27% lower at ₹7.40 apiece on the BSE.

347.title: Pics of Ujjain’s Mahakal Temple Corridor go viral ahead of its inauguration
347.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first phase of the ₹850-crore Mahakaleshwar Temple Corridor Development Project in Ujjain on Tuesday. The Mahakal Path contains 108 pillars which depict Anand Tandav Swaroop of Lord Shiva. The mural wall along the path is based on Shiva Purana stories such as the act of creation, birth of Ganesh, story of Sati and Daksha.

348.title: VLC Media Player site blocked in India over data transfer to 'hostile country': Report
348.article_body: The IT Ministry ordered the blocking of the VLC Media Player website after it was reportedly found communicating with servers of a previously banned app by the ministry which was transferring sensitive personal data of Indians to a "hostile country".
