Earlier, VideoLAN, the operator of VLC, had sent a legal notice seeking to know the reason for the same.

349.title: They were close friends, even died together: Families of kids who drowned in Gurugram
349.article_body: The six boys who drowned in a rainwater-filled pit in Gurugram's Sector 111 were a group of close-knit friends who grew up together, played together and even died together, said their family members. "We have been living here for last 15 years, like a close-knit family. The children's bond brought our families closer," said father of one of the deceased.

350.title: Twitter investor sues Musk over 'fraudulent' conduct in buyout deal
350.article_body: A Twitter investor has sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk, alleging that his conduct in regard to Twitter buyout deal was "fraudulent and illegal". Investor Giuseppe Pampena accused Musk of manipulating Twitter's stock price by making statements that created doubt about the $44 billion deal. "Musk hoped to...re-negotiate the buyout price by as much as 25%," the lawsuit alleged.

351.title: WhatsApp working to increase group size to 1,024 people: Report
351.article_body: WhatsApp is testing an update that will allow users to add up to 1,024 participants in a group, WABetaInfo reported. The update has been rolled out to some beta testers, the report added. The messaging app is reportedly also developing tools like a list of pending participants and an approval system to give admins more control over these larger groups.

352.title: Belarus, Russia to deploy joint military group on Belarus' border with Ukraine
352.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has announced that Belarus and Russia will deploy a joint military task force, local media said. "Ukraine isn't just discussing but planning strikes on the territory of Belarus," Lukashenko reportedly said. "Ukraine doesn't pose a threat...I urge Belarusian military: don't follow criminal orders," Belarusian opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya said.

353.title: Sitharaman to participate in IMF-World Bank meet in US
353.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will leave for the US today to attend a meeting of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank. She will be in the US until October 16. During her visit, she will hold a bilateral meeting with US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen. She is also scheduled to visit the National Science Foundation.

354.title: Death toll from landslide in Venezuela rises to 36; 56 still missing
354.article_body: The death toll following a landslide in Venezuela's Tejerias town has risen to 36, authorities said. At least 56 people are still missing. "We're trying to save whoever we can and are expressing our condolences to all those who have lost a loved one," Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodriguez said. President Nicolas Maduro has declared three days of national mourning.

355.title: 3 Class 5 students drown while fishing in pond in Tamil Nadu's Erode
355.article_body: Three children, including an 11-year-old and two 10-year-old boys, drowned while fishing in a pond in Tamil Nadu's Erode district on Monday, said police. The victims studied in Class 5 of the same school. Their parents filed a missing complaint after they didn't return home till 8 pm. The bodies were found after 30 minutes of search in the pond.

356.title: Gym trainer arrested for molesting woman in Mumbai
356.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a gym trainer under Section 354 of the IPC for allegedly molesting a 25-year-old woman. The victim told the police that the accused touched her inappropriately under the pretext of training. According to reports, the 35-year-old accused has been employed at the gym for the past four years.

357.title: Shraddha Kapoor's 'Naagin' trilogy put on hold: Report
357.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's 'Naagin' trilogy, which was supposed to go on floors in May this year, has been reportedly put on hold due to the "dry spell" in the Hindi film industry. As per a report, the makers might revisit the VFX-heavy film after Shraddha's untitled film with Ranbir Kapoor. The trilogy will feature Shraddha as a shape-shifting serpent.

358.title: Fraudster impersonates a professor, cheats Mumbai man of ₹90,000
358.article_body: A 35-year-old gymnastics coach from Mumbai was cheated of ₹90,000 by a fraudster who texted him on WhatsApp with profile picture of a professor he knew. The fraudster asked him to urgently send her 20 e-gift cards worth ₹5,000 each as she was not carrying her ATM card. Later, the real professor warned people of the fraud through WhatsApp status.

359.title: Delhi Police reach former Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's home, summon him
359.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday reached former Delhi Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's residence in the national capital and summoned him. Police have asked Gautam to join a probe in connection with a row over a religious conversion event. Gautam has been asked to appear for questioning at 2 pm today.

360.title: 6 of family get buried under sand while collecting it, die in Raj
360.article_body: Six members of a family died after they got buried under sand while collecting it for the repair of their house in Rajasthan's Karauli on Monday, officials said. Four other people were also injured in the incident and are undergoing treatment, a police station in-charge said. The District Collector has promised compensation for the surviving family members.

361.title: Odisha starts preparing for possible cyclones in coming months
361.article_body: The Odisha government has directed officials to start preparing for possible cyclones over the next two months, despite there being no forecast by the weather office. The state faces cyclonic storms in October and November and sometimes even till December 15. State Chief Secretary SC Mohapatra said that this period is considered the "cyclone season" of the state.

362.title: Action taken against 55 Hyd police officials since Dec 2021 for various offences
362.article_body: As many as 55 officials have been punished, which includes being removed from service, for various offences, by Hyderabad Commissioner of Police CV Anand since December 2021. According to data released by police, 22 of the 55 policemen were removed from service, whereas, the Commissioner terminated probation of 15 other personnel. As many as 17 personnel were dismissed from service.

363.title: Video of panther chameleon shared by IFS officer goes viral
363.article_body: An undated video of a panther chameleon shared by an IFS officer has gone viral on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, IFS officer Susanta Nanda wrote, "Who can be a better painter than God." Reacting to the video, users wrote, "Is it for real? Extremely beautiful!" and, "Nature not God. But yes beautiful, nonetheless."

364.title: 5 men gangrape 15-year-old girl in front of her mother in Jharkhand
364.article_body: As many as five men allegedly gangraped a 15-year-old girl in front of her mother in Jharkhand's Deoghar district, police said. According to the complaint, the accused on two motorcycles stopped them while they were returning from a function and took the girl aside by force and also beat up her mother. Two people have been detained so far.

365.title: Talked to Kanye, expressed my concerns: Musk after Twitter locks rapper's account
365.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said he talked to rapper Kanye West after Twitter locked his account over an anti-Semitic tweet. "Talked to ye (West) today & expressed my concerns about his recent tweet, which I think he took to heart," Musk tweeted. The rapper's account was locked just a day after he returned to Twitter in nearly two years.

366.title: Teen breaks into house in Pune, steals valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh; held
366.article_body: Pune City Police arrested an 18-year-old within a few hours after he stole valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh from a house. The accused broke into the house in Lohiya Nagar and stole ₹2 lakh in cash and some gold ornaments, police said. Police acted on a tip-off and arrested the accused from Ganj Peth, and recovered the stolen cash and gold.

367.title: The legend who inspired me always: Rajinikanth on Amitabh Bachchan's b'day
367.article_body: Rajinikanth wished Amitabh Bachchan on his birthday and called him "the legend" who "always inspired" him. He tweeted, "The one true sensation and superhero of our glorious Indian film fraternity enters 80...happy birthday my dearest and most respected Amitabh ji." Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan, granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda and others also shared their birthday wishes for him.

368.title: Poland checks condition of bomb shelters amid Ukraine war
368.article_body: As Russian invasion of Ukraine continues, Poland's Deputy Interior Minister Maciej Wasik said that Polish fire services are checking the condition of the country's bomb shelters and compiling an inventory. Poland was not under threat, but was preparing for the worst-case scenario, Wasik added. Poland has 62,000 bomb shelters and the process of checking the shelters will last two months.

369.title: There's groundswell of anger against BJP across J&K: Farooq Abdullah
369.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that there is a groundswell of anger against BJP across J&K and the people there have made it a point to stand up for their rights. Furthermore, he said that the NC will make every effort to give voice to the aspirations and demands of the people of J&K.

370.title: Traffic block at Pune's Chandani Chowk from 12.30 am to 1 am from today
370.article_body: The traffic on Pune's Chandani Chowk stretch will be stopped for 30 minutes between 12.30 am and 1 am for 8-10 days starting today. The Pune district administration and the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have taken the decision to carry out rock blasting work for the ongoing construction of the new bridge and service road.

371.title: Mulayam Singh's mortal remains kept at Saifai's Numaish ground; people pay last respects
371.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's mortal remains have been kept at Numaish ground in Saifai, his ancestral home, for people to pay their last respects. The three-time UP CM's last rites will be performed on Tuesday. The cremation is scheduled to take place around 3 pm. Mulayam Singh passed away aged 82 in Haryana on Monday.

372.title: Mumbai Crime Branch arrests 5 linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D gang
372.article_body: The Anti Extortion Cell of the Mumbai Crime Branch has arrested five people who are associated with the D gang of underworld don Dawood Ibrahim in connection with an extortion case. This comes after the arrest of gangster Salim Fruit, a close aide of gangster Chhota Shakeel and Riyaz Bhati, who in turn are close aides of Dawood.

373.title: Woman on scooter gets run over after being hit by door of car; K'taka govt shares video
373.article_body: Karnataka State Road Safety Authority has shared a video of a woman two-wheeler rider falling and getting run over by a vehicle after being hit by a parked car's door. "Before opening the door of your car on public roads, make sure to check in the side or rear view mirror for vehicles coming from behind," the authority tweeted.

374.title: Political fallout hasn't influenced my relationship with B'wood: Fawad Khan
374.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan said the "political fallout (between India and Pakistan)" hasn't influenced his relationship with the Hindi film industry. Talking about his Bollywood comeback, Fawad said people who'd like to collaborate with him will "suffer the consequences". He added, "Similarly, if I were to work [in India] and come back (to Pakistan), I'd have to suffer the consequences."

375.title: Told Babar 'Ask Shaheen to bowl yorker at 100 mph' to dismiss Rohit: Raja
375.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Babar Azam regarding the T20 World Cup 2021 match between India and Pakistan, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said, "[I told Babar] I can tell you how to...dismiss Rohit Sharma." "Babar was intrigued. I said, 'Get Shaheen Afridi [to]...bowl...[an] inswinging yorker at 100 mph and don't give Rohit a single...You will get him out'," stated Raja.

376.title: Make this Diwali a happy and healthy Diwali: Oleev
376.article_body: Oleev shared that since cooking oil used in food matters as much as the ingredients, one must make a conscious choice in choosing it, especially during the festive season. Oleev Active is a multisource oil with the goodness of olive oil for Indian cooking, it stated, encouraging customers to choose health, good habits and a proactive lifestyle this Diwali.

377.title: Aaron Finch reprimanded by ICC after stump mic catches him abusing umpire
377.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch has been handed an official reprimand for breaching Level 1 of ICC Code of Conduct during the first T20I against England in Perth on Sunday. Finch was caught by the stump mic abusing umpire during a confusion over DRS in the ninth over of England's innings. One demerit point has been added to Finch's disciplinary record.

378.title: My father thought I won't pass, I got around 66% in Class 10 boards: MS Dhoni
378.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni, at a recent event, said that his father thought he would not pass his Class 10 board exam. Dhoni added, "He [thought] it's gone and that I will have to repeat." Dhoni added that he went on to get around 66% marks. "He was very happy that I passed," Dhoni further said.

379.title: Twitter ordered Zatko to burn notebooks, delete files to destroy evidence: Musk
379.article_body: Elon Musk has accused Twitter officials of ordering whistleblower Peiter Zatko to destroy evidence of their missteps as part of a $7.8 million severance package. Musk's lawyers claimed in a court filing that Zatko burned 10 handwritten notebooks and deleted 100 computer files at the behest of Twitter managers. The documents contained notes of Zatko's meetings with the company's officials.

380.title: Shinde faction submits new symbols 'shining sun', 'shield & sword' to EC
380.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena on Tuesday submitted new party symbols 'shining sun', 'shield & sword' and 'peepul tree' as its election symbol options to Election Commission of India (ECI). The new symbols were submitted days after EC's order of freezing Shiv Sena's name and election symbol. Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray faction was allotted 'flaming torch' as their election symbol.

381.title: Crypto firm Coinbase gets Singapore licence for payment services
381.article_body: Coinbase, the US' largest cryptocurrency exchange, received approval from Singapore's central bank to offer payment services in the city. Coinbase called it a "significant milestone" and said it has been building up its presence in Singapore and currently had nearly 100 employees there. About 180 crypto firms applied for payment licences in Singapore and 17 have received in-principle approvals.

382.title: Axar Patel can do it: Chahal on Ravindra Jadeja's alternative for T20 WC
382.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has backed Axar Patel to do the job for the team in all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's absence in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "No one can take Jadeja's place. But the way Axar has been bowling, we've found one alternative...he can do it," stated Chahal. Axar has picked a total of 10 wickets in last six T20Is.

383.title: No data compromise proof found from cyberattack: Lloyd's of London
383.article_body: Insurance company Lloyd's of London, which was investigating a possible cyberattack, said on Monday that it had found no evidence of data compromise. "Lloyd's has been advised that its network services can now be restored," the company said. The firm had detected "an unusual activity on its network" as companies are on high alert for intrusions due to Russia-Ukraine conflict.

384.title: Iran adds centrifuges banned under 2015 nuke deal to underground plant: Report
384.article_body: Iran has brought advanced centrifuges at its underground plant at Natanz, Reuters said citing a confidential report by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The 2015 nuclear deal banned Iran from adding these advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium. The indirect talks between Iran and the United States on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal have been stalled.

385.title: Musk's Starlink in talks with DoT for satellite communication services in India: Report
385.article_body: Elon Musk's Starlink is reportedly in talks with the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) for a  licence to deliver satellite-based communication services in India. To provide this service, companies need to get Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite (GMPCS) licence from the government. The report while quoting sources said that Starlink is likely to apply for the same within a month.

386.title: Big B surprises fans waiting outside his home at midnight for his birthday
386.article_body: A video showing Amitabh Bachchan surprising fans waiting outside his home at midnight for his 80th birthday has surfaced online. The video also shows fans hugging each other in joy, upon Bachchan's arrival. The actor stepped out of his bungalow along with his daughter Shweta Bachchan Nanda and granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda.

387.title: Chief Justices of Rajasthan, Karnataka, J&K and Ladakh HCs named
387.article_body: The central government has notified the transfer of Justice Pankaj Mithal to Rajasthan High Court as the Chief Justice. Justice PB Varale has been appointed as the Chief Justice of Karnataka High Court, while Justice AM Magrey as the Chief Justice of J&K and Ladakh High Court, tweeted Union Minister Kiren Rijiju.

388.title: Big B's Israeli fan says he's learnt Hindi only by listening to his dialogues
388.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's fan from Israel, Moses Sapir, said he has learnt to speak Hindi only by listening to the actor's dialogues. "I have seen most of [his] films more than 200 times...films like 'Silsila' and 'Main Azaad Hoon' were a bit tough for me to understand during my childhood...watching these films repeatedly made me become extremely fond," he added.

389.title: Congress came to power in Raj due to strength of party workers: Pilot
389.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday said that the Congress came to power in Rajasthan in 2018 because of the strength of its workers who had struggled for five years. Furthermore, he said that party workers and leaders are working collectively to ensure the party's victory in the 2023 Assembly polls.

390.title: TSRTC's new facility to allow people to track 3,800 buses in real-time
390.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC)  has created a new facility that will allow passengers to track buses in real-time. This facility will allow passengers to track 3,800 buses in real-time. Reports said that the authorities have installed a tracking device in buses for this purpose. Passengers will be able to see arrival and departure times too.

391.title: Yati Narsinghanand gets bail in case linked to Muzaffarnagar riots
391.article_body: Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi temple priest Yati Narsinghanand was released on bail after he surrendered before a court in Uttar Pradesh in a case linked to 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots. According to Prosecution Officer Niraj Singh, Narsinghanand is among the 21 accused, including Union Minister Sanjeev Balyan, facing charges of violating prohibitory orders and inciting communal violence.

392.title: No legal basis to act on Russian superyacht: Hong Kong leader
392.article_body: Hong Kong leader John Lee said the city has "no legal basis" to act on a luxury yacht belonging to sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov. "We'll [only] comply with UN sanctions," Lee added. Mordashov was sanctioned by the European Union and US, but not the UN after Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The yacht docked in Hong Kong waters last week.

393.title: CJI UU Lalit recommends Justice DY Chandrachud as his successor
393.article_body: Chief Justice of India UU Lalit has recommended the name of Justice DY Chandrachud as his successor. Justice UU Lalit, who took oath as the Chief Justice on August 27, is set to retire on November 8 this year. The appointment of Justice DY Chandrachud will make him the 50th Chief Justice of India.

394.title: Flew Smith to Perth to make him 12th man, that's not right: Michael Clarke
394.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has criticised the Australian management for not including Steve Smith in their playing XI for the first England T20I. "Flew Smith to Perth to make him 12th man, that's not right," stated Clarke. On Australia's batting order for the T20 WC, Clarke added, "If Smith [is batting at four], you've got to give him some cricket."

395.title: NCP, Shiv Sena, SP to take part in Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra
395.article_body: As the Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra is set to reach Maharashtra on November 9, NCP, Shiv Sena, SP and other like-minded parties will be taking part in the campaign. "The BJP government at the Centre has made the future of citizens dark. The BJP wants to eliminate other parties through non-parliamentary means," said Congress leader Nana Patole.

396.title: NIA conducts raids at multiple locations in J&K in terror funding case
396.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday carried out raids at multiple locations in Jammu and Kashmir in a terror funding case. The searches were conducted at locations in the districts of Rajouri, Poonch, Jammu, Srinagar, Pulwama, Budgam, Shopian and Bandipora. The case is related to the suspicious activities of Al Huda Educational Trust in J&K's Rajouri, as per reports.

397.title: TCS to give 100% variable pay to 70% of employees for Q2 FY23
397.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will give 100% variable pay to 70% of its employees for the second quarter of FY23. "The remaining 30% of employees will be paid...based on the business unit performance," Chief Human Resources Officer Milind Lakkad said. In August, TCS said it hadn't delayed variable payout for Q1 and it was fully paid out to all employees.

398.title: Thai PM orders tighter gun rules after mass shooting killed 36 people
398.article_body: After an ex-policeman killed 36 people including 24 children in Thailand, Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha ordered authorities to revoke the gun licences of registered owners who have reportedly behaved in a way that "threatens society". He has also ordered search and test for the use of illicit drugs among officials. Regular mental checks will be reportedly required for gun licence.

399.title: Deepika Padukone meets & interacts with mental health patients, shares pics
399.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone and her mental health foundation Live Love Laugh's team interacted with mental health patients and their caregivers in rural areas of Tamil Nadu's Thiruvallur. Sharing pictures of her visit on Instagram, Deepika wrote, "Since our inception, we have been relentless in our efforts to improve the lives of those experiencing mental illness, as well as...their caregivers."

400.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra will bring back democracy in country: Cong's Mallu Ravi
400.article_body: Congress leader Mallu Ravi praised Rahul Gandhi for the Bharat Jodo Yatra, saying the campaign will restore the country's Constitution and democracy. "There is no freedom of speech and no freedom to question the government. Rahul Gandhi raised this issue in Parliament as there is no change in the attitude of the Centre and the TRS government," said Ravi.

401.title: Man pays woman to teach in his place at school in Gurugram; 3 held
401.article_body: A man who allegedly hired a woman to teach at a school in his place in Gurugram's Sector 54 was arrested by the CM's flying squad on Monday. The woman and the school headmaster were also arrested. The man, who did all this in connivance with the headmaster, used to pay the woman ₹8,000/month, DSP of CM's flying squad said.
